units.title: Detachment of hPSCs
units.text: RC17, H9, and HS1001 hPSCs were detached from the culture dish with 0.5 mM Accutase (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc, #A1110501) and prepared as a concentrated single cell suspension (20,000 cells/µL in iPS Brew).
units.rationale: Provides the initial cell preparation step for downstream organoid generation.

units.title: Initiation of 3D VM organoid differentiation
units.text: Differentiation was initiated by plating 2500 single cells in each well of a 96-well U-bottom plate (Corning, #CLS7007) in iPS Brew with 10 µM Y-27632 1.5 μM CHIR99021, and in the presence of 200 mM dihydrochloride (Miltenyi, #130-106-538), as previously described27.
units.rationale: Defines the seeding conditions that start organoid formation.

units.title: Transfer of embryoid bodies to differentiation medium
units.text: embryoid bodies were transferred to differentiation medium consisting of 1:1 DMEM/F12:Neurobasal medium, 1% nonessential amino acids (MEM-NEAA, Sigma-Aldrich, #M7145), 1:100 N2 supplement, 0.1% 2-mercaptoethanol (Merck, #8057400005), 10 μM SB431542 (Miltenyi, #130-106-543), and 150 ng/ml rhNoggin.
units.rationale: Specifies the composition of the medium that drives further lineage specification.

units.title: Silk‑scaffold preparation
units.text: A 20 µL droplet of Biosilk protein solution was placed in the center of hydrophobic culture wells in a 24-well plate (Sarstedt, #833922500). Recombinant human laminin-111 was added to the silk protein solution at a final concentration of 10 μg ml−1. The FN-silk/LN-111 mixture was incubated 10 min at RT before usage.
units.rationale: Creates the silk‑based matrix used for organoid integration.

units.title: Foam generation within silk droplets
units.text: Air bubbles were introduced into the droplet by pipetting up and down (10–15 strokes), creating a dense foam. Multiple foams are generated in series with uniform shape and size (Supplementary Fig. 7b).
units.rationale: Ensures even distribution of cells within the silk scaffold.

units.title: Organoid cryosectioning
units.text: VM organoids were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde for 5 h at 4 °C followed by washing in PBS three times for 10 min. The interaction were left to sink in 30% sucrose overnight. Sucrose solution was replaced with 1:1 OCT:30% sucrose mixture for 6 h and then transferred to a cryomold and filled with OCT. The embedded tissue was frozen on dry ice and either cryosectioned at 20 μm or stored at −80 °C.
units.rationale: Prepares thin sections for histological analysis.

units.title: Immunohistochemistry blocking step
units.text: Sections were washed in PBS1X for 10 min and then blocked and permeabilized in 0.3% Triton X-100 and 5% normal donkey serum in PBS1X.
units.rationale: Reduces non‑specific antibody binding before primary antibody incubation.

units.title: Whole‑cell patch‑clamp recording
units.text: Cells with neuronal morphology and round cell body were selected for recordings. Resting-membrane potentials were monitored immediately after breaking-in in current-clamp mode. Thereafter, cells were injected from −85 pA to +165 pA with 20 pA increments to induce action potentials.
units.rationale: Measures electrophysiological properties of organoid neurons.

units.title: Calcium imaging of MAP2‑GCamP5 neurons
units.text: Imaging was performed on an inverted Ti2 microscope (Nikon) equipped with a CSU‑W1 spinning‑disc system (Yokogawa), a sCMOS camera (Teledyne Photometrics), and a 20× objective. An environment control chamber was used to maintain the temperature at 37 °C and CO2 level at 5% during imaging.
units.rationale: Captures intracellular calcium dynamics in live organoid neurons.

units.title: Chronoamperometric dopamine detection
units.text: Three‑electrode setup with a pyrolyzed carbon fibre as the working electrode was used to detect dopamine. The organoid was placed on the working electrode immersed in baseline buffer, a constant potential was applied, and the resulting current was monitored.
units.rationale: Quantifies dopamine release from organoids in real time.
